Entity-restful_api.description: A RESTful API is an application programming interface that adheres to the principles of Representational State Transfer, allowing for interaction with web services through standard HTTP methods.

Entity-australian_government_record_inte.label: Australian Government Records Interoperability Framework
Entity-australian_government_record_inte.description: The Australian Government Records Interoperability Framework is a structured approach designed to enhance the compatibility and exchange of records across various government agencies in Australia.

Entity-startend_timestamps.label: start/end timestamps
Entity-startend_timestamps.description: Start/end timestamps refer to specific points in time that indicate the beginning and conclusion of an event or process.

Entity-built-in_restful_api.label: built-in RESTful API
Entity-built-in_restful_api.description: A built-in RESTful API is a web service interface that allows for the integration and interaction with software applications using standard HTTP methods to perform operations on resources.

Entity-modular_design.label: modular design
Entity-modular_design.description: Modular design is an architectural and design approach that emphasizes the creation of systems or products composed of interchangeable and independent components, allowing for flexibility, scalability, and ease of maintenance.

summary:
Extraction of categorised named entities from text is a complex task given the availability of a variety of Named Entity Recognition (NER) models and the unstructured information encoded in different source document formats. Processing the documents to extract text, identifying suitable NER models for a task, and obtaining statistical information is important in data analysis to make informed decisions. This paper presents1 TNNT, a toolkit that automates the extraction of categorised named entities from unstructured information encoded in source documents, using diverse state-of-the-art (SOTA) Natural Language Processing (NLP) tools and NER models. TNNT integrates 21 different NER models as part of a Knowledge Graph Construction Pipeline (KGCP) that takes a document set as input and processes it based on the defined settings, applying the selected blocks of NER models to output the results. The toolkit generates all results with an integrated summary of the extracted entities, enabling enhanced data analysis to support the KGCP, and also, to aid further NLP tasks.

NER is a major component in NLP systems to extract information from unstructured text. Recent advances in deep learning and NLP have resulted in the availability of a large number of NER tools and models for use which have enabled NER of different categories from text. However, given the existence of a wide range of document formats, extracting information is difficult considering the preprocessing required prior to using NER tools and the challenge of identifying which models to use. It is desirable to have a system that can provide (1) a uniform processing pipeline of different document formats, (2) easy selection of different NLP-NER models or tools, (3) an integrated summary of the entities identified by the models, and (4) basic functionalities to access the results; in order to enhance data analysis with accurate decisions and to provide a thorough overview of the data used.

This paper introduces TNNT2 . Its main goal is to automate the extraction of categorised named entities from the unstructured information encoded in the source documents, using a wide range of recent SOTA NLP-NER tools and models. TNNT is integrated with the “Metadata Extractor & Loader" (MEL) [10], which enables extraction of metadata and content-based information from various file formats such as .pdf, .docx, .xlsx, .msg, .csv, .txt, and .zip. We have brought together the existing SOTA NER models and NLP tools under one toolkit, enabling effortless NER analysis for unstructured content-based information. The motivations of the toolkit are: (1) to be able to easily pre-process documents for NER analysis, (2) to be able to easily use documents with different formats for NER analysis, (3) to hide usage variations across NER models and NLP tools, and bring them under one uniform pipeline, and (4) to provide a framework for analysing results from different NER models and NLP tools. Having several SOTA models under one umbrella provides many benefits such as their easy execution and comparison, and, most interestingly, it can help to identify the most suited block of NER models for a specific task or input domain.

There are a wide range of libraries, such as NLTK [7], spaCy3, Stanford NER [8], Stanza [9], and Flair [1], that provide models facilitating NER. To the best of our knowledge, there is no toolkit or system that unifies under one uniform pipeline several SOTA tools and models for NER: TNNT fills this void.

TNNT integrates 21 different NER models from 9 SOTA NLP tools (Table 1). Some of these models are based on rule-based and statistical approaches whereas others are based on deep learning techniques4 . These 21 models can identify up to 18 categories (Table 2) of named entities in text. The system is capable of processing different models sequentially based on the input settings (processing blocks) defined by the user. All textual content extracted by MEL is processable for TNNT with a hybrid processing data flow, either from/to a document store or via direct processing from the file system.

For data analysis tasks, TNNT keeps general statistics of the models and generates an integrated summary of all the identified entities. The results are JSON files (one for each processed source document) with the list of models, categories, and identified entities. For each recognised entity, the toolkit retrieves a set of information specific to the entity . A built-in RESTful API provides various features to access, expand, complement, and co-relate the NER results by performing other NLP tasks, such as Part-Of-Speech (POS) tagging, dependency parsing, and co-reference resolution. This comprehensive information facilitates the apprehension of the models as well the data used for NLP tasks in general and, in particular, for tasks associated with knowledge building.

TNNT was designed to systematically apply various NER models to analyse textual content extracted via MEL. Whereas the latter implements several data extraction operations, the former provides a modular and extensible framework for NER analysis using multiple models and NLP tools. In a nutshell, TNNT is fully integrated with MEL as shown in Figure 1. The toolkit's processing model is depicted in Figure 2. The first two blocks are orchestrated by MEL which establishes how TNNT will process a block sequence of NER models to apply over the input dataset (either from a document store or from a direct document processing immediately after the metadata extraction task).

TNNT's inner architecture is composed of a pre-processing module and one distinct module for each implemented NLP-NER tool and models. Based on the input document formats (file extensions), the pre-processing module takes the extracted text data by MEL and cleans/prepares it for the NER analysis task. The core analysis task on the input data is sequentially performed for all the selected NER models. TNNT's modular design enables a smooth selection and processing mechanism of the NER models. For each recognised entity, the toolkit retrieves its context information, and start/end indices in the document text. Furthermore, it provides statistics of the entities identified by each model for respective categories along with the start/end timestamps and the duration taken by the models to run the NER task. Table 3 gives an overview of the results obtained using some of the models for two publicly available datasets: CONLL 20036 and NIST IE-ER7 . The toolkit has a set of comprehensive configuration files that specify all the required details and processing parameters for each implemented NLP tool and NER model. Users can experiment with various models by simply defining the desired settings.

TNNT's RESTful API refines and improves the NER results by adding more processing layers of abstraction to perform several useful operations, such as POS tagging, dependency parsing, coreference resolution, aggregations, descriptive stats, and browsing capabilities, as shown in Figure 3. This module allows users to smoothly traverse and retrieve the NER results. Its specifications and usage can be found at the project's w3id URI.

TNNT provides a simple mechanism and uniform pipeline to extract categorised named entities from unstructured data using a diverse range of SOTA NLP tools and NER models. This tool is still in its early stages of development. It has been tested using thousands of different document formats and datasets as part of the “Australian Government Records Interoperability Framework" (AGRIF) project [4]. There are ongoing plans to integrate more NLP-NER tools and models into the architecture along with continuing evolving the RESTful API with complementary NLP tasks to enrich the NER results, in order to support KGCP tasks. The major contributions of this toolkit are: (1) the ability to process different source document formats for NER; (2) the availability of 21 different SOTA NER models integrated into one system, enabling easy selection of models for NER; (3) the provision of an integrated summary of the results from different models; and (4) a RESTful API that enables easy access to NLP tasks that enrich the NER results from the models.

Predicate-is_related_to.label: is related to
Predicate-is_related_to.description: The predicate 'is related to' establishes a connection or association between the subject and the object, indicating that there is a relevant link, correlation, or interaction between the two entities. This relationship can encompass various forms of relevance, such as functional, contextual, or conceptual ties, suggesting that understanding one may provide insights into the other.

Predicate-is_encoded_in.label: is encoded in
Predicate-is_encoded_in.description: The predicate 'is encoded in' establishes a relationship where the subject is represented or stored within the framework or structure of the object. It indicates that the subject's information or data is transformed into a specific format or medium defined by the object, allowing for its preservation, transmission, or interpretation.

Predicate-is_important_in.label: is important in
Predicate-is_important_in.description: The predicate 'is important in' establishes a relationship where the subject is recognized as having significant relevance, value, or influence in the context of the object. It indicates that the subject plays a crucial role or contributes meaningfully to the area or field represented by the object.

Predicate-is_obtained_in.label: is obtained in
Predicate-is_obtained_in.description: The predicate 'is obtained in' indicates a relationship where the subject is derived or acquired through the process or activity represented by the object. It suggests that the subject cannot exist or be realized without the context or method provided by the object, highlighting a dependency on the object for the subject's existence or formation.

Predicate-helps_make.label: helps make
Predicate-helps_make.description: The predicate 'helps make' indicates a supportive or facilitative relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject contributes to the process or outcome represented by the object. It suggests that the subject provides assistance, resources, or insights that enable the creation, formulation, or realization of the object, thereby enhancing the ability to achieve or produce it.

Predicate-includes.label: includes
Predicate-includes.description: The predicate 'includes' establishes a relationship where the subject encompasses or contains the object as a part of its broader category or scope. It indicates that the object is a component, subset, or example that falls within the domain defined by the subject.

Predicate-utilise.label: utilise
Predicate-utilise.description: The predicate 'utilise' indicates the action of making practical or effective use of a resource, tool, or method (the subject) to achieve a specific purpose or to process, manipulate, or derive value from something (the object). It emphasizes the application of the subject in a way that enhances functionality or efficiency in relation to the object.

Predicate-extract.label: extract
Predicate-extract.description: The predicate 'extract' denotes the action of retrieving or obtaining specific information or elements from a larger set or context. In the context of the subject and object, it indicates that the subject performs the action of identifying and isolating the object from a broader dataset or environment, thereby transforming the object into a more accessible or usable form.

Predicate-process.label: process
Predicate-process.description: The predicate 'process' indicates an action or operation performed by the subject on the object, where the subject applies methods, techniques, or systems to transform, analyze, or manipulate the object in order to achieve a specific outcome or result.

Predicate-integrates.label: integrates
Predicate-integrates.description: The predicate 'integrates' denotes the action of combining or unifying different components, systems, or entities into a cohesive whole. It implies that the subject effectively incorporates the object, which can be a set of tools, models, or methodologies, to enhance functionality, performance, or interoperability. This process often involves ensuring that the integrated elements work together seamlessly to achieve a common goal or to improve overall effectiveness.

Predicate-takes.label: takes
Predicate-takes.description: The predicate 'takes' indicates that the subject is capable of receiving or utilizing the object as an input or resource in its process or operation. It establishes a relationship where the subject actively engages with the object, implying that the object is necessary for the subject to function or achieve its intended purpose.

Predicate-processes.label: processes
Predicate-processes.description: The predicate 'processes' indicates an action or function performed by the subject that involves the transformation, manipulation, or handling of the object. In this context, it signifies that the subject is actively engaged in a series of operations or activities that affect the object, leading to a change or outcome related to it. This relationship highlights the dynamic interaction between the subject and the object, where the subject's capabilities or mechanisms are utilized to work with or alter the object in some meaningful way.

Predicate-applies.label: applies
Predicate-applies.description: The predicate 'applies' indicates a relationship where the subject utilizes, implements, or employs the object in a relevant context or process. It signifies that the subject is actively engaging with the object in a manner that is intended to achieve a specific outcome or function.

Predicate-output.label: output
Predicate-output.description: The predicate 'output' signifies the action or process by which the subject produces or generates the object, indicating a relationship where the subject's activities or functions lead to the creation or delivery of the object as a result.

Predicate-generates.label: generates
Predicate-generates.description: The predicate 'generates' indicates a relationship in which the subject produces, creates, or brings about the object, often implying a process or action that leads to the formation or emergence of the object as a result of the subject's activity.

Predicate-enables.label: enables
Predicate-enables.description: The predicate 'enables' indicates that the subject provides the means, capability, or opportunity for the object to occur or be realized. It suggests a facilitative relationship where the subject contributes to the enhancement, improvement, or implementation of the object, allowing it to be achieved or performed effectively.

Predicate-aids.label: aids
Predicate-aids.description: The predicate 'aids' indicates a supportive or beneficial relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject provides assistance, resources, or enhancements that contribute to the advancement or completion of the object. In this context, the subject is actively involved in facilitating the progress or effectiveness of the object.

Predicate-provides.label: provides
Predicate-provides.description: The predicate 'provides' indicates a relationship in which the subject offers, supplies, or makes available a particular resource, service, or information to the object. It signifies an action where the subject fulfills a need or requirement of the object by delivering something of value or utility.

Predicate-summarizes.label: summarizes
Predicate-summarizes.description: The predicate 'summarizes' indicates a relationship where the subject provides a condensed representation or overview of the information contained in the object. It implies that the subject distills the essential points or main ideas from the object, which consists of more detailed or extensive content.

Predicate-supports.label: supports
Predicate-supports.description: The predicate 'supports' indicates a relationship in which the subject provides assistance, reinforcement, or facilitation to the object, thereby enhancing its effectiveness, functionality, or overall performance. This connection implies that the subject plays a beneficial role in enabling or promoting the capabilities or objectives of the object.

Predicate-is_a_major_component_in.label: is a major component in
Predicate-is_a_major_component_in.description: The predicate 'is a major component in' indicates that the subject plays a significant and essential role within the context of the object. It suggests that the subject is not only a part of the object but is also crucial for its functionality, effectiveness, or overall structure. This relationship highlights the importance of the subject in contributing to the success or operation of the object.

Predicate-extracts_information_from.label: extracts information from
Predicate-extracts_information_from.description: The predicate 'extracts information from' indicates a process in which the subject actively retrieves, identifies, or derives relevant data, insights, or knowledge from the object. This relationship highlights the subject's capability to analyze and interpret the content of the object, transforming it into a more structured or usable form. The object typically represents a source of raw or unorganized data, while the subject represents an entity or system that performs the extraction, often employing various techniques or methodologies to achieve this.

Predicate-have_resulted_in.label: have resulted in
Predicate-have_resulted_in.description: The predicate 'have resulted in' indicates a causal relationship where the subject has led to or produced the object as a consequence of certain actions, developments, or changes. It implies that the subject's influence or impact has directly contributed to the emergence or existence of the object.

Predicate-enable.label: enable
Predicate-enable.description: The predicate 'enable' signifies a facilitative relationship where the subject provides the necessary means, tools, or conditions that allow or empower the object to occur or be achieved. In this context, it indicates that the subject plays a crucial role in making the action or process represented by the object possible.

Predicate-exist.label: exist
Predicate-exist.description: The predicate 'exist' establishes a relationship between the subject and the object by indicating that the subject has a presence or is found in reality, while the object specifies the nature or type of that presence. It conveys the idea that the subject is associated with or encompasses the characteristics or instances described by the object.

Predicate-is_difficult_considering.label: is difficult considering
Predicate-is_difficult_considering.description: The predicate 'is difficult considering' establishes a relationship between the subject and the object by indicating that the subject's complexity or challenge is influenced by the factors or conditions represented by the object. It suggests that the difficulty of the subject is not absolute but is contingent upon the context or circumstances denoted by the object.

Predicate-required_prior_to_using.label: required prior to using
Predicate-required_prior_to_using.description: The predicate 'required prior to using' establishes a necessary condition or prerequisite that must be fulfilled before the subject can effectively utilize the object. It indicates that the subject's action or process is contingent upon the completion or implementation of the object, suggesting a sequence where the object is essential for the proper functioning or application of the subject.

Predicate-enhances.label: enhances
Predicate-enhances.description: The predicate 'enhances' indicates that the subject contributes positively to the quality, effectiveness, or performance of the object. It implies an improvement or augmentation of the object's capabilities or characteristics, suggesting that the subject plays a supportive or facilitating role in making the object better or more efficient.

Predicate-can_provide.label: can provide
Predicate-can_provide.description: The predicate 'can provide' indicates the capability or potential of the subject to supply or make available the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject is positioned as a source or facilitator that offers certain resources, services, or functionalities to the recipient or user represented by the object. This connection implies that the subject has the necessary means or attributes to fulfill the needs or requirements expressed by the object.

Predicate-introduces.label: introduces
Predicate-introduces.description: The predicate 'introduces' signifies an action where the subject presents or brings attention to the object, often in a context that provides new information, insights, or concepts. It implies a relationship where the subject serves as a source or medium for the dissemination of knowledge regarding the object.

Predicate-is_to_automate.label: is to automate
Predicate-is_to_automate.description: The predicate 'is to automate' indicates the intention or purpose of the subject in relation to the object, suggesting that the subject aims to implement a process or system that will perform the actions associated with the object automatically, thereby enhancing efficiency and reducing the need for manual intervention.

Predicate-from.label: from
Predicate-from.description: The predicate 'from' indicates a source or origin in the relationship between the subject and the object. It connects the subject, which represents an action or process, to the object, which signifies the material, context, or environment from which the subject derives or extracts information, resources, or elements. This relationship emphasizes the directional flow of information or action, highlighting that the subject is obtaining or processing something that exists within the object.

Predicate-used_in.label: used in
Predicate-used_in.description: The predicate 'used in' indicates a functional relationship where the subject is employed or applied within the context of the object. It signifies that the subject serves a purpose or role in facilitating, contributing to, or enabling the processes, activities, or outcomes described by the object.

Predicate-is_integrated_with.label: is integrated with
Predicate-is_integrated_with.description: The predicate 'is integrated with' indicates a relationship where the subject is connected or combined with the object in a way that allows them to function together as a cohesive unit. This integration suggests that the subject and object share data, processes, or functionalities, enhancing their overall capabilities and enabling them to work in conjunction to achieve a common goal or improve efficiency.

Predicate-enables_extraction_of.label: enables extraction of
Predicate-enables_extraction_of.description: The predicate 'enables extraction of' signifies a functional relationship where the subject provides the capability or means to obtain or retrieve specific types of information or data represented by the object. This indicates that the subject is equipped to facilitate the process of accessing or deriving the specified content or metadata, thereby enhancing the ability to gather relevant insights or knowledge.

Predicate-extracts_from.label: extracts from
Predicate-extracts_from.description: The predicate 'extracts from' indicates a relationship where the subject is capable of obtaining or deriving information, data, or content from the object. This implies a process of retrieval or collection, where the subject utilizes the object as a source or reference point to gather relevant material or insights.

Predicate-brought_together_with.label: brought together with
Predicate-brought_together_with.description: The predicate 'brought together with' indicates a relationship where the subject is combined or associated with the object, suggesting a collaborative or integrative connection between the two entities. This connection often implies that the subject and object complement each other or work in conjunction to achieve a common goal or enhance functionality.

Predicate-is_for.label: is for
Predicate-is_for.description: The predicate 'is for' establishes a relationship of purpose or intended use between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject is designed, intended, or suitable for the function or role described by the object, thereby connecting the two in a way that highlights the utility or application of the subject in relation to the object.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' serves as a linking verb that establishes an identity or equivalence between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject possesses the characteristics or qualities described by the object, effectively defining or categorizing the subject within a specific context.

Predicate-helps_to_identify.label: helps to identify
Predicate-helps_to_identify.description: The predicate 'helps to identify' indicates a supportive or facilitative relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject provides assistance, tools, or methods that enable the recognition or determination of the characteristics, features, or classifications represented by the object.

Predicate-suited_for.label: suited for
Predicate-suited_for.description: The predicate 'suited for' indicates a relationship where the subject is appropriate or well-matched for the requirements or characteristics of the object. It implies that the subject possesses qualities, features, or capabilities that align with the needs or specifications of the object, thereby making it a suitable choice for fulfilling a particular role or function.

Predicate-automates.label: automates
Predicate-automates.description: The predicate 'automates' indicates that the subject performs a process or function that reduces or eliminates the need for human intervention in the execution of the object. In this context, it signifies that the subject is capable of carrying out the task represented by the object in an efficient and systematic manner, thereby streamlining operations and enhancing productivity.

Predicate-aims_to_automate.label: aims to automate
Predicate-aims_to_automate.description: The predicate 'aims to automate' indicates the intention or goal of the subject to implement processes or systems that reduce or eliminate the need for human intervention in the specified object. It connects the subject with the object by expressing a proactive effort to enhance efficiency, accuracy, or productivity in the context of the task or function described by the object.

Predicate-is_a_type_of.label: is a type of
Predicate-is_a_type_of.description: The predicate 'is a type of' establishes a categorical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject belongs to a broader class or category represented by the object. It signifies that the subject shares common characteristics or functions with other entities within the specified category, thereby providing a way to classify or organize knowledge about the subject in relation to the object.

Predicate-is_a_type_of_(1).label: is a type of
Predicate-is_a_type_of_(1).description: The predicate 'is a type of' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific category or classification within the broader category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the subject shares certain characteristics or properties with other entities that fall under the same object category.

Predicate-fills.label: fills
Predicate-fills.description: The predicate 'fills' denotes an action or process where the subject occupies or completes a space, capacity, or requirement represented by the object. It implies that the subject provides substance, content, or fulfillment to the object, thereby transforming the state of the object from being empty or lacking to being full or satisfied.

Predicate-are_based_on.label: are based on
Predicate-are_based_on.description: The predicate 'are based on' establishes a foundational relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject derives its principles, methods, or frameworks from the object. It suggests that the subject's characteristics, functionalities, or operations are fundamentally influenced or determined by the object, which serves as a source or reference point.

Predicate-are_based_on_(1).label: are based on
Predicate-are_based_on_(1).description: The predicate 'are based on' indicates that the subject is founded upon, derived from, or relies on the principles, methods, or concepts represented by the object. It establishes a foundational relationship where the subject's characteristics, functionalities, or operations are influenced or determined by the object.

Predicate-can_identify.label: can identify
Predicate-can_identify.description: The predicate 'can identify' denotes the capability or ability of the subject to recognize, distinguish, or classify the object. In this context, it implies that the subject possesses the necessary features, knowledge, or functionality to accurately detect or categorize the specified object, which can be entities, items, or concepts within a defined scope.

Predicate-is_capable_of_processing.label: is capable of processing
Predicate-is_capable_of_processing.description: The predicate 'is capable of processing' indicates that the subject possesses the ability or functionality to handle, analyze, or manage the object, which typically refers to data, information, or a set of items. This connection implies that the subject can effectively perform operations or tasks related to the object, demonstrating competence in dealing with the specified elements.

Predicate-defined_by.label: defined by
Predicate-defined_by.description: The predicate 'defined by' establishes a relationship where the subject is characterized or specified by the object, indicating that the object provides the criteria, parameters, or context that shape the understanding or nature of the subject.

Predicate-are_processed_based_on.label: are processed based on
Predicate-are_processed_based_on.description: The predicate 'are processed based on' indicates that the subject undergoes a transformation, analysis, or evaluation that is influenced or determined by the criteria or parameters specified in the object. It establishes a relationship where the processing of the subject is contingent upon the characteristics or conditions outlined in the object.

Predicate-is_used_for.label: is used for
Predicate-is_used_for.description: The predicate 'is used for' establishes a functional relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject serves a specific purpose or function that is fulfilled by the object. It implies that the subject is employed or utilized in a manner that directly relates to achieving, supporting, or facilitating the object.

Predicate-involves.label: involves
Predicate-involves.description: The predicate 'involves' indicates a relationship where the subject is engaged in or requires the object as a necessary component, part, or aspect of its function or operation. It suggests that the object plays a significant role in the context of the subject, contributing to its overall purpose or process.

Predicate-flows_fromto.label: flows from/to
Predicate-flows_fromto.description: The predicate 'flows from/to' indicates a directional relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject represents a source or origin that generates or emits a flow, and the object represents a destination or target that receives or absorbs that flow. This relationship can be understood in terms of the movement or transfer of data, resources, or information, highlighting the dynamic interaction between the two entities.

Predicate-flows_via.label: flows via
Predicate-flows_via.description: The predicate 'flows via' indicates a directional movement or transfer of information, resources, or processes from the subject to the object, highlighting the medium or pathway through which this flow occurs. It establishes a relationship where the subject utilizes the object as a conduit or means to facilitate the flow.

Predicate-is_processable_for.label: is processable for
Predicate-is_processable_for.description: The predicate 'is processable for' indicates that the subject can be effectively handled, analyzed, or manipulated in relation to the object. It suggests a compatibility or suitability between the subject and the object, where the subject possesses characteristics or qualities that allow it to be processed or utilized by the methods, tools, or frameworks represented by the object.

Predicate-keeps.label: keeps
Predicate-keeps.description: The predicate 'keeps' indicates a relationship where the subject maintains, retains, or holds onto the object over time. It suggests an ongoing action or state in which the subject is responsible for the existence or preservation of the object, implying a sense of continuity and stability in the connection between them.

Predicate-are.label: are
Predicate-are.description: The predicate 'are' serves as a linking verb that connects the subject to the object, indicating that the subject is being identified or classified as the object. It establishes a state of existence or condition, suggesting that the subject possesses the qualities or characteristics represented by the object.

Predicate-contain.label: contain
Predicate-contain.description: The predicate 'contain' indicates that the subject includes or holds within it the object, suggesting a relationship where the object is a part or component of the subject. This relationship implies that the subject has the capacity to encompass or incorporate the object in some form.

Predicate-retrieves.label: retrieves
Predicate-retrieves.description: The predicate 'retrieves' indicates an action performed by the subject that involves obtaining or extracting a specific set of information from a source or database. It implies a process where the subject actively seeks out and acquires data or knowledge, resulting in the subject gaining access to the object, which is the information being retrieved.

Predicate-accesses.label: accesses
Predicate-accesses.description: The predicate 'accesses' indicates a relationship where the subject is able to retrieve, utilize, or interact with the object. It implies that the subject has the capability or permission to reach or obtain information or resources represented by the object, facilitating a connection between the two entities.

Predicate-expands.label: expands
Predicate-expands.description: The predicate 'expands' indicates a relationship where the subject enhances, increases, or broadens the scope, detail, or quantity of the object. It suggests that the subject contributes additional information, functionality, or context to the object, thereby enriching its overall value or understanding.

Predicate-complements.label: complements
Predicate-complements.description: The predicate 'complements' indicates a relationship where the subject enhances, completes, or adds value to the object, suggesting that the two elements work together to create a more comprehensive or effective outcome.

Predicate-co-relates.label: co-relates
Predicate-co-relates.description: The predicate 'co-relates' indicates a relationship of connection or association between the subject and the object, suggesting that they are linked in a way that one may influence, complement, or provide context to the other. This relationship implies that understanding or analyzing one element can provide insights into the other, highlighting their interdependence or relevance in a broader context.

Predicate-perform.label: perform
Predicate-perform.description: The predicate 'perform' indicates an action or process where the subject executes, carries out, or engages in the activities or functions represented by the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject is the agent that actively undertakes the tasks or operations denoted by the object, often implying a level of skill, capability, or intention in executing those tasks.

Predicate-facilitates.label: facilitates
Predicate-facilitates.description: The predicate 'facilitates' indicates that the subject provides support, assistance, or resources that make it easier for the object to occur or be achieved. It implies a positive influence or enhancement of the process or action represented by the object, suggesting that the subject plays a crucial role in enabling or promoting the successful realization of the object.

Predicate-is_associated_with.label: is associated with
Predicate-is_associated_with.description: The predicate 'is associated with' indicates a relationship of connection or relevance between the subject and the object. It suggests that the subject has a link, correlation, or relationship to the object, implying that they share some common characteristics, functions, or contexts. This predicate is often used to denote that the subject is related to the object in a meaningful way, whether through causation, influence, or contextual relevance.

Predicate-designed_to_apply.label: designed to apply
Predicate-designed_to_apply.description: The predicate 'designed to apply' indicates that the subject has been specifically created or structured with the intention of being utilized in conjunction with the object. It implies a purposeful relationship where the subject is tailored to effectively implement or integrate with the object in a relevant context.

Predicate-apply_to_analyse.label: apply to analyse
Predicate-apply_to_analyse.description: The predicate 'apply to analyse' indicates a process in which the subject utilizes a specific method, tool, or framework to examine, interpret, or evaluate the object, which is typically a set of data, information, or content. This relationship suggests that the subject is actively engaging with the object to derive insights, understand patterns, or extract meaningful information.

Predicate-extracted_via.label: extracted via
Predicate-extracted_via.description: The predicate 'extracted via' indicates the method or process through which the subject is obtained or derived, linking the subject to the object that represents the specific technique, tool, or system used for extraction.

Predicate-implements.label: implements
Predicate-implements.description: The predicate 'implements' denotes the action of putting a plan, decision, or method into effect. It connects the subject, which is typically an entity or system, to the object, which represents the specific actions, processes, or functionalities that are being executed or carried out by the subject. In this context, the subject is responsible for executing the operations or tasks described in the object.

Predicate-is_depicted_in.label: is depicted in
Predicate-is_depicted_in.description: The predicate 'is depicted in' establishes a relationship where the subject is represented or illustrated within the context of the object. This indicates that the object serves as a medium, such as a figure, diagram, or visual representation, that conveys information about the subject, allowing for a visual understanding or interpretation of the subject's characteristics, structure, or function.

Predicate-comes_from.label: comes from
Predicate-comes_from.description: The predicate 'comes from' indicates a source or origin relationship between the subject and the object. It signifies that the subject is derived from, or has its roots in, the object, establishing a connection that implies the object is the place, entity, or context from which the subject is obtained or originates.

Predicate-occurs_after.label: occurs after
Predicate-occurs_after.description: The predicate 'occurs after' establishes a temporal relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the action or event represented by the subject takes place subsequent to the action or event represented by the object. This implies a sequence in which the object is completed or realized before the subject begins.

Predicate-is_composed_of.label: is composed of
Predicate-is_composed_of.description: The predicate 'is composed of' indicates a relationship where the subject is made up of or consists of the elements represented by the object. It implies that the object is a fundamental part or component that contributes to the overall structure or functionality of the subject.

Predicate-cleansprepares.label: cleans/prepares
Predicate-cleansprepares.description: The predicate 'cleans/prepares' indicates an action performed by the subject that involves the modification or enhancement of the object to make it suitable for further processing or analysis. This action typically includes removing unwanted elements, organizing, or formatting the object in a way that improves its quality or usability.

Predicate-is_prepared_for.label: is prepared for
Predicate-is_prepared_for.description: The predicate 'is prepared for' indicates that the subject has undergone a process of modification, organization, or enhancement to make it suitable or ready for the specific purpose or task represented by the object. This relationship implies that the subject has been tailored or equipped in a way that facilitates the successful execution of the task denoted by the object.

Predicate-is_performed_for.label: is performed for
Predicate-is_performed_for.description: The predicate 'is performed for' indicates a relationship where the subject is an action or task that is carried out with the intention of achieving a specific purpose or benefit represented by the object. It implies that the execution of the subject is directed towards fulfilling the needs or requirements associated with the object.

Predicate-is_performed_on.label: is performed on
Predicate-is_performed_on.description: The predicate 'is performed on' establishes a relationship where the subject, typically an action or task, is executed or applied to the object, which is usually a resource or entity. This indicates that the subject relies on or utilizes the object as a foundational element for its execution, highlighting the dependency of the action on the specific resource.

Predicate-run.label: run
Predicate-run.description: The predicate 'run' indicates the action performed by the subject, which involves executing or carrying out a specific process or task represented by the object. In this context, it signifies that the subject is actively engaging in the operation of the object, leading to the completion or execution of the task.

Predicate-identified_by.label: identified by
Predicate-identified_by.description: The predicate 'identified by' establishes a relationship where the subject is recognized or categorized through the lens of the object. It indicates that the object serves as a means or method for recognizing, labeling, or defining the subject, suggesting a connection where the subject's characteristics or properties are discerned or articulated by the object.

Predicate-gives_an_overview_of.label: gives an overview of
Predicate-gives_an_overview_of.description: The predicate 'gives an overview of' indicates that the subject provides a summary or a general outline of the information or content represented by the object. It suggests that the subject presents key points or highlights that encapsulate the essence of the object, allowing the audience to grasp the main ideas without delving into detailed specifics.

Predicate-used_for.label: used for
Predicate-used_for.description: The predicate 'used for' indicates the purpose or function of the subject in relation to the object. It connects the subject to the object by specifying that the subject is employed or applied in a manner that serves the object, highlighting the utility or application of the subject in a particular context.

Predicate-are_for.label: are for
Predicate-are_for.description: The predicate 'are for' indicates a purpose or intended use of the subject in relation to the object. It establishes a connection where the subject is associated with or serves the function of the object, often implying that the subject is designed, applicable, or relevant to the object.

Predicate-has.label: has
Predicate-has.description: The predicate 'has' indicates a possession or ownership relationship between the subject and the object. It signifies that the subject possesses, contains, or is associated with the object, which can be an entity, attribute, or collection of items. This relationship implies that the subject is the holder or bearer of the object, establishing a link that conveys the existence of the object in relation to the subject.

Predicate-specify.label: specify
Predicate-specify.description: The predicate 'specify' indicates a relationship where the subject provides detailed information or clarification about the object. In this context, the subject defines or outlines particular characteristics, requirements, or parameters that are relevant to the object, thereby establishing a clear and precise connection between the two.

Predicate-experiment_with.label: experiment with
Predicate-experiment_with.description: The predicate 'experiment with' indicates an action where the subject engages in a process of testing, trying out, or exploring different options, methods, or items represented by the object. This interaction suggests a hands-on approach to learning or discovery, where the subject seeks to gain insights, evaluate performance, or understand the characteristics of the object through practical application.

Predicate-define.label: define
Predicate-define.description: The predicate 'define' indicates an action where the subject establishes, articulates, or specifies the characteristics, parameters, or meaning of the object. It implies a process of clarification or determination, where the subject takes an active role in shaping the understanding or configuration of the object.

Predicate-can_experiment_with.label: can experiment with
Predicate-can_experiment_with.description: The predicate 'can experiment with' indicates the ability or opportunity of the subject to engage in testing, trying out, or exploring different options or variations represented by the object. It suggests a process of hands-on interaction or investigation, where the subject actively seeks to understand, evaluate, or innovate using the object.

Predicate-refines_and_improves.label: refines and improves
Predicate-refines_and_improves.description: The predicate 'refines and improves' indicates a process in which the subject enhances the quality, accuracy, or effectiveness of the object. This involves making adjustments, optimizations, or modifications that lead to a better or more precise outcome. In the context of the example, it suggests that the subject is actively working to elevate the performance or results of the object, resulting in a more refined and improved state.

Predicate-adds.label: adds
Predicate-adds.description: The predicate 'adds' indicates that the subject contributes to or incorporates the object, resulting in an enhancement, increase, or inclusion of the object within the context of the subject. This relationship suggests that the subject provides additional value, functionality, or complexity by integrating the object into its framework or operation.

Predicate-shown_in.label: shown in
Predicate-shown_in.description: The predicate 'shown in' indicates that the subject is represented or illustrated within the context of the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject is visually or conceptually depicted in the object, which often serves as a reference point for understanding or analyzing the subject.

Predicate-allows.label: allows
Predicate-allows.description: The predicate 'allows' indicates that the subject provides permission, capability, or opportunity for the object to perform a certain action or access a specific feature. It establishes a relationship where the subject enables the object to engage in activities or utilize functionalities that would otherwise be restricted or unavailable.

Predicate-can_be_found_at.label: can be found at
Predicate-can_be_found_at.description: The predicate 'can be found at' establishes a locational relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is accessible or available at the specified location represented by the object. This predicate is commonly used to denote where information, resources, or entities can be located or retrieved.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates that the subject actively employs or utilizes the object in order to achieve a specific purpose or function. It establishes a relationship where the subject relies on the object as a resource, tool, or method to perform tasks, solve problems, or enhance capabilities.

Predicate-applies_to.label: applies to
Predicate-applies_to.description: The predicate 'applies to' establishes a relationship where the subject is relevant or pertinent to the object, indicating that the subject can be utilized, is suitable for, or has a connection with the object in a specific context or domain.

Predicate-is_in.label: is in
Predicate-is_in.description: The predicate 'is in' establishes a relationship of inclusion or presence between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject exists within the context or state defined by the object. It suggests that the subject is currently situated within a specific phase, condition, or environment represented by the object.

Predicate-tested_using.label: tested using
Predicate-tested_using.description: The predicate 'tested using' indicates a method or approach employed to evaluate the effectiveness, functionality, or performance of the subject in relation to the object. It connects the subject to the object by specifying the tools, conditions, or materials that were utilized during the testing process, thereby providing context for the assessment of the subject's capabilities.

Predicate-integrate_into.label: integrate into
Predicate-integrate_into.description: The predicate 'integrate into' signifies the process of combining or incorporating a subject into a larger system or framework represented by the object. It implies a seamless incorporation where the subject becomes a functional part of the object, enhancing its capabilities or functionality.

Predicate-evolving_with.label: evolving with
Predicate-evolving_with.description: The predicate 'evolving with' indicates a dynamic relationship where the subject undergoes development or transformation in conjunction with the object. This suggests that the subject is adapting, improving, or changing in response to the characteristics, requirements, or advancements of the object, leading to a synergistic progression between the two entities.

Predicate-enrich.label: enrich
Predicate-enrich.description: The predicate 'enrich' indicates a process in which the subject enhances, improves, or adds value to the object, resulting in a more comprehensive or effective outcome. This often involves the integration of additional information, features, or resources that contribute to the overall quality or performance of the object.

Predicate-are_planned_to_be_integrated_i.label: are planned to be integrated into
Predicate-are_planned_to_be_integrated_i.description: The predicate 'are planned to be integrated into' indicates a future intention or strategy to incorporate the subject into the object. It suggests that there is a deliberate effort to combine or embed the subject within the framework, system, or structure represented by the object, highlighting a goal of enhancing functionality, compatibility, or performance.

Predicate-are_integrated_into.label: are integrated into
Predicate-are_integrated_into.description: The predicate 'are integrated into' indicates a process in which multiple components or entities (the subject) are combined or incorporated into a single cohesive unit or framework (the object). This integration suggests a functional relationship where the individual elements contribute to the overall operation or effectiveness of the system they are being integrated into.

Predicate-has_been_tested_using.label: has been tested using
Predicate-has_been_tested_using.description: The predicate 'has been tested using' indicates that the subject has undergone evaluation or experimentation through the application of specific methods, tools, or resources represented by the object. This relationship implies that the subject's performance, functionality, or reliability has been assessed in relation to the conditions or materials specified in the object.

Predicate-utilizes.label: utilizes
Predicate-utilizes.description: The predicate 'utilizes' indicates that the subject actively employs or makes use of the object in order to achieve a specific purpose or function. It suggests a practical application where the subject leverages the capabilities or features of the object to fulfill a need or enhance performance.

Predicate-automates_the_extraction_of_ca.label: automates the extraction of categorized named entities from
Predicate-automates_the_extraction_of_ca.description: The predicate 'automates the extraction of categorized named entities from' indicates a process whereby a subject implements a system or method that efficiently identifies and retrieves specific types of named entities—such as people, organizations, or locations—from a given source of unstructured data. This automation enhances the ability to organize and analyze information by categorizing these entities, thereby transforming raw data into structured insights.

Predicate-is_integrated_into.label: is integrated into
Predicate-is_integrated_into.description: The predicate 'is integrated into' indicates a relationship where the subject is incorporated or combined with the object, suggesting that the subject becomes a part of or is utilized within the framework, system, or context represented by the object. This integration implies a functional or operational connection, where the subject enhances, contributes to, or operates alongside the object.

Predicate-are_utilized_within.label: are utilized within
Predicate-are_utilized_within.description: The predicate 'are utilized within' indicates that the subject is employed or applied in the context of the object, suggesting a functional relationship where the subject serves a purpose or contributes to the operation of the object.

Predicate-extract_entities_from.label: extract entities from
Predicate-extract_entities_from.description: The predicate 'extract entities from' denotes the action of identifying and retrieving specific pieces of information, known as entities, from a given source material, which is typically a collection of text or documents. In this context, the subject represents the tools or methods employed to perform the extraction, while the object signifies the source from which the entities are being derived. This process is fundamental in natural language processing and information retrieval, enabling the transformation of unstructured data into structured information.

Predicate-automates_the_extraction_of.label: automates the extraction of
Predicate-automates_the_extraction_of.description: The predicate 'automates the extraction of' indicates a process by which the subject facilitates or streamlines the retrieval and processing of specific types of information from a source, typically reducing manual effort and increasing efficiency. The object represents the type of information being extracted, which can vary in nature and format, such as data, content, or insights derived from unstructured sources.

Predicate-is_a_component_of.label: is a component of
Predicate-is_a_component_of.description: The predicate 'is a component of' indicates a relationship where the subject is an integral part or element that contributes to the overall structure, function, or purpose of the object. It signifies that the subject cannot be fully understood or utilized without considering its connection to the object, which represents a broader category or system that encompasses the subject.

Predicate-facilitates_the_extraction_of_.label: facilitates the extraction of categorized named entities from
Predicate-facilitates_the_extraction_of_.description: The predicate 'facilitates the extraction of categorized named entities from' indicates a process or action where the subject enables or aids in the identification and retrieval of specific types of named entities that are organized into categories, utilizing the resources or methods specified in the object. This implies a supportive role of the subject in enhancing the capability to analyze and interpret data through the application of various models and natural language processing tools.

Predicate-automates_the_extraction_of_ca.label: automates the extraction of categorized named entities from
Predicate-automates_the_extraction_of_ca.description: This predicate indicates a process whereby a subject, typically a system or tool, performs the task of identifying and retrieving named entities that are organized into specific categories from a given set of textual data. It implies that the subject enhances efficiency and accuracy in processing the object, which consists of raw text, by systematically recognizing and classifying relevant entities such as names, organizations, locations, and other predefined categories.

Predicate-is_processed_by.label: is processed by
Predicate-is_processed_by.description: The predicate 'is processed by' indicates a relationship where the subject undergoes a transformation, manipulation, or analysis as a result of the actions or functions performed by the object. It signifies that the object is the agent or mechanism that applies a process to the subject, leading to a change in state or form of the subject.

Predicate-facilitates_the_extraction_and.label: facilitates the extraction and analysis of
Predicate-facilitates_the_extraction_and.description: The predicate 'facilitates the extraction and analysis of' indicates that the subject provides support, resources, or mechanisms that enable the process of obtaining and examining specific data or information represented by the object. It implies an enhancement of efficiency or effectiveness in handling the data, allowing for better understanding, interpretation, or utilization of the extracted information.

Predicate-facilitates_the_systematic_ana.label: facilitates the systematic analysis of
Predicate-facilitates_the_systematic_ana.description: The predicate 'facilitates the systematic analysis of' indicates that the subject provides support or enables a structured and methodical examination or evaluation of the object. This implies that the subject plays a crucial role in making it easier to conduct a thorough investigation or assessment of the object, which may involve various methodologies, frameworks, or tools.

Predicate-is_part_of.label: is part of
Predicate-is_part_of.description: The predicate 'is part of' indicates a relationship where the subject is a component, element, or segment that contributes to the whole represented by the object. This connection implies that the subject cannot be fully understood or appreciated without recognizing its association with the object, which serves as the larger context or framework within which the subject exists.

Predicate-is_analyzed_by.label: is analyzed by
Predicate-is_analyzed_by.description: The predicate 'is analyzed by' indicates a relationship where the subject undergoes a process of examination or evaluation, typically involving the extraction of insights or understanding from the object. In this context, the subject represents a framework, system, or methodology that is being scrutinized or interpreted through the lens of the object, which is the data or information being assessed. This relationship highlights the role of the object as a source of information that contributes to the analysis of the subject.

Predicate-is_extracted_from.label: is extracted from
Predicate-is_extracted_from.description: The predicate 'is extracted from' indicates a relationship where the subject serves as the origin or source from which the object is derived or obtained. It implies a process of retrieval or separation, where specific elements or information are taken out from a larger whole, resulting in the object that represents the extracted content.

Predicate-is_processed_from.label: is processed from
Predicate-is_processed_from.description: The predicate 'is processed from' indicates a relationship where the subject undergoes a transformation or manipulation that derives it from the object. This implies that the subject is a result of applying certain methods or techniques to the object, which serves as the source material or raw input. The processing typically involves extracting, refining, or converting the object into a more usable or structured form represented by the subject.

Predicate-is_analyzed_using.label: is analyzed using
Predicate-is_analyzed_using.description: The predicate 'is analyzed using' establishes a relationship where the subject undergoes a process of examination or evaluation through the application of the methods, tools, or frameworks represented by the object. It indicates that the subject is the focus of analysis, while the object specifies the means or techniques employed to conduct that analysis.

Predicate-facilitates_the_preprocessing_.label: facilitates the preprocessing and analysis of
Predicate-facilitates_the_preprocessing_.description: The predicate 'facilitates the preprocessing and analysis of' indicates that the subject provides support or enables the processes of preparing and examining the object. It implies that the subject plays a crucial role in streamlining or enhancing the efficiency of handling the object, which in this context refers to data or information that requires organization, transformation, or evaluation before it can be effectively utilized or understood.

Predicate-is_extracted_by.label: is extracted by
Predicate-is_extracted_by.description: The predicate 'is extracted by' indicates a relationship where the subject undergoes a process or action that results in the identification or retrieval of specific elements represented by the object. It signifies that the subject serves as a source or context from which the object is derived or obtained, highlighting the action of extraction as a means of obtaining relevant information or components.

Predicate-extract_(1).label: extract
Predicate-extract_(1).description: The predicate 'extract' denotes the action of obtaining or deriving specific information, data, or components from a broader source or context. In the context of the subject and object, it indicates that the subject is performing the act of retrieval or separation to yield the object, which represents the particular items or elements being obtained.

Predicate-provides_a_framework_for.label: provides a framework for
Predicate-provides_a_framework_for.description: The predicate 'provides a framework for' indicates that the subject offers a structured approach, system, or set of guidelines that facilitates the understanding, analysis, or implementation of the object. It implies that the subject serves as a foundational basis or reference point that supports the development or evaluation of the object in a coherent and organized manner.

Predicate-facilitates_the_evaluation_and.label: facilitates the evaluation and comparison of outputs
Predicate-facilitates_the_evaluation_and.description: The predicate 'facilitates the evaluation and comparison of outputs' indicates that the subject provides support or mechanisms that enable the assessment and juxtaposition of results derived from the object. This implies that the subject plays a crucial role in making it easier to analyze and contrast the performance or effectiveness of various outputs, thereby enhancing understanding and decision-making regarding the object.

Predicate-analyses.label: analyses
Predicate-analyses.description: The predicate 'analyses' denotes the action of examining, interpreting, or breaking down information or data in order to understand its structure, meaning, or significance. In the context of a subject and an object, it indicates that the subject is performing a detailed investigation or evaluation of the object, which typically consists of data, documents, or results, to derive insights or conclusions.

Predicate-is_the_primary_objective_of.label: is the primary objective of
Predicate-is_the_primary_objective_of.description: The predicate 'is the primary objective of' establishes a relationship where the subject is identified as the main aim or goal that is intended to be achieved or pursued, as represented by the object. This indicates that the subject serves as a focal point or driving force behind the efforts or actions directed towards fulfilling the object.

Predicate-can_be_processed_and_analyzed_.label: can be processed and analyzed using
Predicate-can_be_processed_and_analyzed_.description: The predicate 'can be processed and analyzed using' establishes a relationship where the subject is capable of undergoing a transformation or examination through the application of the methods, tools, or frameworks represented by the object. It implies that the subject, which may be a type of data, information, or content, can be effectively handled and interpreted by employing the specified techniques or models, thereby facilitating understanding, extraction of insights, or decision-making.

Predicate-enables_the_application_of.label: enables the application of
Predicate-enables_the_application_of.description: The predicate 'enables the application of' indicates that the subject provides the necessary conditions, tools, or framework that allows for the effective use or implementation of the object. It suggests a facilitative relationship where the subject empowers or supports the utilization of the object in a practical context.

Predicate-automates_the_extraction_of_ca.label: automates the extraction of categorized named entities from
Predicate-automates_the_extraction_of_ca.description: This predicate indicates that the subject implements a process or system that systematically identifies and retrieves named entities from the object, which is typically a body of text or data. The named entities are categorized, meaning they are classified into predefined groups or types, such as people, organizations, locations, etc. The automation aspect suggests that this process is performed with minimal human intervention, enhancing efficiency and accuracy in handling large volumes of information.

Predicate-facilitates_the_extraction_of_.label: facilitates the extraction of categorized named entities from unstructured information
Predicate-facilitates_the_extraction_of_.description: The predicate 'facilitates the extraction of categorized named entities from unstructured information' describes a process in which a subject, such as various models or tools, enables or enhances the ability to identify and classify specific entities within a body of unstructured data, like documents. This connection implies that the subject provides the necessary mechanisms or methodologies that allow for the systematic identification and categorization of named entities, thereby transforming raw, unstructured information into a more organized and interpretable format.

Predicate-is_processed_to_obtain.label: is processed to obtain
Predicate-is_processed_to_obtain.description: The predicate 'is processed to obtain' indicates a transformation or manipulation of the subject, resulting in the creation or extraction of the object. It implies that the subject undergoes a series of operations or procedures aimed at deriving the object, which represents the outcome or product of this processing.

Predicate-provides_a_framework_for_analy.label: provides a framework for analysing results from different NER models and NLP tools based on the extracted entities from documents
Predicate-provides_a_framework_for_analy.description: The predicate establishes a relationship where the subject serves as a structured approach or system that facilitates the evaluation and interpretation of outcomes derived from various Named Entity Recognition (NER) models and Natural Language Processing (NLP) tools. This evaluation is grounded in the entities that have been extracted from the object, which represents the source material, typically documents. Thus, the predicate indicates that the framework is designed to enhance understanding and comparison of results by leveraging the information obtained from the documents.

Predicate-contains.label: contains
Predicate-contains.description: The predicate 'contains' indicates that the subject holds, includes, or possesses the object within its scope or boundaries. It establishes a relationship where the subject is seen as a container or holder of the object, which represents the content or elements that are encompassed by the subject.

Predicate-extracts_categorized_named_ent.label: extracts categorized named entities using
Predicate-extracts_categorized_named_ent.description: The predicate 'extracts categorized named entities using' describes the action of identifying and classifying specific entities within a given subject, utilizing various methodologies or frameworks. It indicates a process where the subject, such as documents, is analyzed to retrieve and categorize distinct entities, such as names of people, organizations, or locations, through the application of different models or techniques.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or subset that falls under a more general category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider range of concepts or entities than the subject, thereby situating the subject within a broader context.
